# MasTec, Inc. (MTZ) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

MasTec, Inc. is a leading North American infrastructure engineering and construction company focused primarily on engineering, building, installation, maintenance and upgrade of communications, energy and utility and other infrastructure. The company is the second largest Hispanic-owned company in the United States with over 20,000 employees in North America. It operates through five segments: Communications, Clean Energy and Infrastructure, Power Delivery, Pipeline Infrastructure, and Other, serving both wireless and wireline/fiber infrastructure; Power Delivery serving primarily utility customers in transmission and distribution markets; Pipeline Infrastructure serving energy and other customers with installation and maintenance services primarily for natural gas pipeline and distribution infrastructure; and Clean Energy and Infrastructure, providing renewable energy engineering and construction services, as well as for heavy civil and other industrial infrastructure markets.

Founded in 1994 and listed on the New York Stock Exchange in 1998, MasTec is headquartered in Coral Gables, Florida. The company has a history spanning over 95 years, with its evolution, particularly under CEO Jose Mas since 2007, marked by strategic vision for diversification and growth, transforming it into a Fortune 500 entity.

## 2. Current Market Data

The market cap of MasTec (MTZ) is $18.61B as of Jan 7, 2026. The all-time high MasTec stock closing price was 236.35 on January 06, 2026. The MasTec 52-week high stock price is 237.76, which is 5.2% above the current share price. The current Mastec(MTZ) stock price is $240.07, with a market capitalization of 18.66B. The stock trades at a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 58.15.

In the last 30 days, MasTec's market capitalization has increased by 7.39%, changing from $17.33B to $18.61B as of Jan 7, 2026. In the year 2025, MasTec's market capitalization increased from $10.79B in January to $17.16B in December, reflecting a 58.99% change.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

The company provides engineering, building, installation, maintenance and upgrade of energy, utility and communications infrastructure. In the Electric Power Industry, MasTec is a contractor that builds and maintains high voltage electric power transmission systems, sub stations and switch yards, and distribution systems. Through their subsidiaries Wanzek Construction and MasTec Power Corp., MasTec is capable of providing design-build, EPC, and construction services for a variety of clients in the utility and private power producing markets.

MasTec builds pipelines for the transportation of crude oil and natural gas. They also build pumping stations, compressor stations, and treatment facilities where oil and natural gas are conditioned before transporting to market. They construct and maintain radio towers for mobile phone carriers, and do the trenching required to install fiber optic cable. Under its subsidiary MasTec Advanced Technologies, the company is also one of the largest providers of in-home installation of DirecTV in the United States and installing residential security systems for AT&T Digital Life.

In the renewable energy sector, MasTec is a contractor that constructs wind farms, solar energy facilities and power plants. Through their wholly owned subsidiary, Wanzek Construction, MasTec has built several wind farms, including Clipper Wind Farm in Jefferson, Minnesota; Taloga Wind Farm, in Putnam, Oklahoma; Crow Lake Wind Farm, in White Lake, South Dakota; Goat Mountain Wind Farm, in Robert Lee, Texas; and Laredo Ridge, in Boone County, Nebraska.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

MasTec is introducing MasTec EVi - Electric Vehicle Charging Solutions for residential, dealerships, and fleet hubs. MasTec provides construction and program construction management and EPC services for the full range of energy transition projects including renewable fuels, carbon capture, hydrogen, and other emerging technologies.

Battery storage is rapidly becoming a larger part of the portfolio, with most projects now incorporating battery opportunities, contributing to growth in 2025 and expected to continue into 2026. MasTec's Power Delivery segment was awarded its second-largest project ever, scheduled to commence in mid-2026.

## 5. Growth Strategy

MasTec is continually cultivating the industry's best technical talent, leveraging over 30 dedicated training facilities throughout the country to prepare the workforce of tomorrow. These skillsets and expertise will provide MasTec with significant opportunities for future growth. We are excited by our market positions, our diversified business model, and our ability to offer our customers integrated solutions at scale.

This journey has involved both significant organic expansion and targeted acquisitions, such as Henkels McCoy Holdings, Inc. in 2021 and IEA in 2022, which, despite initial integration challenges, have broadened MasTec's capabilities and market reach. MasTec continues to execute an active and disciplined acquisition strategy aimed at complementing organic growth and strengthening its service portfolio.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

Its customers are primarily in the utility, communications and government industries, including wireless and wireline/fiber service providers, broadband operators, install-to-the-home service providers, public and private energy providers, including renewable and other energy providers, pipeline operators, civil, transportation, and industrial infrastructure providers, as well as government entities.

BellSouth Telecommunications, Inc. awarded Church & Tower a long-term contract for projects in the greater Miami and Fort Lauderdale areas. The Lumen contract, which began ramping up in recent months, is anticipated to drive solid growth into 2026.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### Q3 2025 Results
Revenues of $3.97 billion topped the consensus mark of $3.89 billion by 1.6%. The top line jumped 22% from a year ago, driven by double-digit growth across all segments. Adjusted earnings per share exceeded expectations, coming in at $2.48, which was $0.20 ahead of consensus. Adjusted EBITDA: $374 million, a 20% year-over-year increase.

### 2025 Guidance
We are increasing 2025 full-year revenue guidance to $14.075 billion with adjusted EBITDA of $1.135 billion, slightly above the low end of our previous guidance. For the full year 2025, our guidance assumes strong 14% growth in revenue and 13% growth in Adjusted EBITDA versus the prior year, and implied growth of 9% for revenue and nearly 20% growth in Adjusted EBITDA for the fourth quarter.

### Backlog
As of Sept. 30, 2025, MTZ had an 18-month backlog of $16.78 billion, up 21.1% year over year and 2% sequentially. MasTec delivered record Q3 results, with 21% y/y backlog growth to $16.8B, providing strong revenue visibility into 2026. MTZ's $16.8B backlog, up 21% y/y, secures nearly 1.2x annual revenue, ensuring robust multi-year growth visibility and supporting double-digit revenue expansion into 2026.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Tailwinds
MTZ is benefiting from record project backlogs and robust demand across multiple end markets, led by its Pipeline Infrastructure segment. Increased multi-year government investments supporting grid reliability, LNG expansion and energy transition infrastructure are driving growth. This robust growth is fueled by dynamic telecom infrastructure demand, as customers make substantial capital investments in broadband delivery and advanced AI applications. MasTec's wireless business is expanding geographically and broadening its service offerings, while wireline demand is surging due to extensive broadband infrastructure build-outs by traditional carriers, cable operators, and new fiber overbuilders.

### Headwinds
Weather-related delays continue to pose execution risks, with MasTec's Power Delivery segment experiencing frequent disruptions despite mitigation efforts. The company also operates in a highly competitive, fragmented industry, where intense competition from national, local and in-house providers could pressure market share and profitability.

## 9. Market Shares

Market Share of MasTec, Inc.: Estimated around 5-7% (2025) in the infrastructure engineering and construction services sector. MasTec's market share is in the mid-single digits, indicating a strong but not dominant position.

### Segment Performance
Clean Energy and Infrastructure (contributing 33% to total 2023 revenues), Communications (27.2%), Power Delivery (22.8%), Oil and Gas (17.3%).

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

Mastec competitors include MYR Group, Quanta Services, EMCOR Group, Crown Castle and Dycom Industries. Quanta Services, Inc. (NYSE: PWR): around 10-12%, Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (NYSE: J): around 7-9%, KBR, Inc. (NYSE: KBR): around 6-8%, EMCOR Group, Inc. (NYSE: EME): around 5-7%.

EMCOR Group's price-to-earnings ratio is 19.01x while MasTec's PE ratio is 51.79x. While competitors like Quanta Services (PWR) may exhibit larger scale in certain energy infrastructure segments and potentially higher overall profitability margins, MasTec's versatility and integrated approach allow it to capture market share in multi-segment projects. Similarly, against specialized electrical contractors like MYR Group (MYRG), MasTec's broader infrastructure solutions offer a more holistic value proposition.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

The company was formed by the merger of two separate companies: Burnup & Sims and Church & Tower. This journey has involved both significant organic expansion and targeted acquisitions, such as Henkels McCoy Holdings, Inc. in 2021 and IEA in 2022, which, despite initial integration challenges, have broadened MasTec's capabilities and market reach.

MasTec's most recent deal was a Merger/Acquisition with NV2A. The deal was made on 22-Dec-2025.

## 12. Recent Developments

### Stock Performance
MasTec (MTZ) stock experienced an approximate 15.8% increase from October 31, 2025, when it closed at $204.16, to January 6, 2026, when it closed at $236.35. The stock's upward momentum was evident as MasTec reached a new 52-week high on January 5, 2026, trading as high as $236.16. Technical analysis also showed a buy signal issued from a pivot bottom point on December 17, 2025, with the stock rising 12.94% since that date.

### Analyst Updates
MasTec had its "overweight" rating reaffirmed by analysts at KeyCorp. They now have a $264.00 price target on the stock. MasTec had its price target raised by analysts at Truist Financial Corporation from $253.00 to $270.00. They now have a "buy" rating on the stock. MasTec was upgraded by analysts at Zacks Research from a "hold" rating to a "strong-buy" rating.

### Leadership Changes
MasTec, Inc. (NYSE: MTZ) today announced that after more than 23 years of service J. Marc Lewis will retire as Vice President of Investor Relations and Chris Mecray will immediately assume that role.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

Based on the comprehensive analysis of MasTec's strong fundamentals, diversified business model, record backlog providing exceptional revenue visibility, and position to capitalize on multi-year infrastructure investment trends driven by energy transition, 5G deployment, and data center demand:

**Buy Rating: 8.5/10**

**Fair Value Estimate: $275**

**Key Investment Strengths:**
- Record $16.8B backlog providing 1.2x revenue coverage and multi-year visibility
- Diversified platform across high-growth secular trends (5G, renewable energy, data centers)
- Strong Q3 2025 performance with 22% revenue growth and 20% EBITDA growth
- Strategic position in critical infrastructure markets with high barriers to entry
- Management guidance for over $15B revenue and $8+ EPS by 2026

**Investment Risks:**
- High valuation multiple (P/E ~58x) creates limited margin for error
- Weather/permitting delays impact project execution timing
- Competitive, fragmented industry with margin pressure risks

The investment thesis is supported by MasTec's unique positioning at the convergence of multiple infrastructure megatrends, exceptional backlog visibility, and proven ability to execute large-scale projects across diversified end markets. While the stock trades at a premium, the company's strong growth trajectory and secular tailwinds justify the valuation for growth-oriented investors with moderate risk tolerance.
tldr_summary:
MasTec is a leading North American infrastructure engineering and construction company specializing in communications, energy, utility, and infrastructure services across five key segments. The company has demonstrated strong growth through strategic diversification, targeting high-potential markets like renewable energy, electric vehicle charging, and telecommunications infrastructure.

With a record $16.8B backlog, MasTec is positioned to capitalize on major infrastructure investment trends, including 5G deployment, grid modernization, and energy transition. Their recent acquisitions and expansions into battery storage and EV charging solutions complement their core business. The company has shown impressive financial performance, with 22% year-over-year revenue growth in Q3 2025 and continued expansion across all segments.

The AI analysis provides a strong Buy rating of 8.5/10, with a fair value estimate of $275, driven by the company's diverse portfolio, robust market positioning, and strategic growth initiatives in critical infrastructure sectors.
